result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy A. Pozdolski

records.addlTxt:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.   Atty Gumz is prepared to proceed. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

1:07 PM Defendant Randy A. Pozdolski appeared by video, in custody from Marquette County Jail.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Randy A. Pozdolski.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
22CF93 & 22CF108 tracking together:
Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.  

BY THE COURT:  Recess

1:30pm BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz has reviewed a plea form with his client.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Prelim today and they will be asking for a PSI.

Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2 in 22CF108.  Counts 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7 to be dismissed and read-in. 22CF93 to be dismissed and read-in.   Atty Burdon requests a PSI.   Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 in 22CF108 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Counts 3, 4, 5, 6 & 7 to be dismissed and read-in.  22CF93 to be dismissed and read-in.

PSI ordered

Atty Gumz makes bail arguments and asks for a reduction in bond to a $500 cash.  Atty Burdon objects to any modification of the bond.
BY THE COURT:  Motion to modify the bond is denied.

State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:22 PM Defendant Randy A. Pozdolski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Randy A. Pozdolski.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz is new to the matters and have not been able to speak with his client before today.  Atty Gumz asks for another status so he is able to request Discovery but he would like to be heard on bail.

Atty Gumz makes bail arguments and asks for a reduction of the bail.  Atty Burdon objects to any bail modification and makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court denies the request for a bond modification
Status hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
This was included with BOND motion but already assigned Attorney Gumz

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:18 AM Defendant Randy A. Pozdolski appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court received a petition for appointment of counsel from the defendant last week.  Court questions the defendant regarding his finances.

BY THE COURT:  Court finds that the defendant does not meet the standards for a court appointed Attorney and denies the request.

Defendant wants to continue with the IA.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court questions the defendant regarding time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued

Defendant asks how to modify the bail.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant to write a letter and he will consider that a motion; set MH
Motion hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Motion hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Prior: 2665 2nd Lane, Oxford, WI 53952 United States

3:32 PM Defendant Randy A. Pozdolski appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Juech requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with Deputy Holmes, Deputy Zeumer, Deputy Nielson or Sgt. Ninneman unless through their official capacity as law enforcement officers
*No possession of any firearms
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no possession or consumption of any alcohol  
*No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Court from Josh Pozdolski (approved for filing by Judge Hendee)
